short_description: This function trains a random forest tree model.
long_description: This function builds an ensemble of decision trees for predictive modeling, based on the CART algorithm.

argument_clauses.name: Domain
argument_clauses.description: The address of the Queen. The host parameter is the Aster Database Queenâ€™s IP saddress or hostname.

argument_clauses.name: Database
argument_clauses.description: The name of the database where the input table is located.

argument_clauses.name: UserId
argument_clauses.description: The Aster Database user name of the user running this function.

argument_clauses.name: Password
argument_clauses.description: The Aster Database password of the user.

argument_clauses.name: SSLSettings
argument_clauses.description: A string that includes all the SSL settings, except the password for the truststore.

argument_clauses.name: SSLTrustStorePassword
argument_clauses.description: The password for the SSL truststore.

argument_clauses.name: InputTable
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the table containing the input data.

argument_clauses.name: OutputTable
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the output table.

argument_clauses.name: MonitorTable
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the monitor table.

argument_clauses.name: ResponseColumn
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the column that contains the response variable

argument_clauses.name: NumericInputs
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the columns that contain the numeric predictor variables

argument_clauses.name: CategoricalInputs
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the columns that contain the categorical predictor variables

argument_clauses.name: TreeType
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether the analysis is a regression or a multiclass classification

argument_clauses.name: NumTrees
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of trees to grow in the forest model The input value must be no less than 1.

argument_clauses.name: TreeSize
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of rows that each tree uses as its input data set The input value must be no less than 1.

argument_clauses.name: MinNodeSize
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of rows that each tree uses as its input data set The input value must be no less than 1. The default value is 1.

argument_clauses.name: Variance
argument_clauses.description: Specifies a decision tree stopping criterion The input value must be no less than 0.0. The default value is 0.0.

argument_clauses.name: MaxDepth
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of rows that each tree uses as its input data set The input value must be no less than 1. The default value is 10.

argument_clauses.name: NumSurrogates
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of rows that each tree uses as its input data set The input value must be no less than 0. The default value is 0.

argument_clauses.name: MaxNumCategoricalValues
argument_clauses.description: Specifies max number of categories in one variable The input value must be greater than 0. The default value is 20.

argument_clauses.name: DropMonitorTable
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether to drop monitor table or not The default value is true.
